title: ACC's first battery gigafactory in France to be operational by end of 2023
notes:
Location:
- The battery production project is located in Billy-Berclau Douvrin, France.

Capacity:
- The initial production line capacity of the facility is more than 13 GWh, scalable to 40 GWh by 2030. The first of the site's three production units will be operational before the end of 2023, with ramp-up scheduled for completion by the end of 2024.

Investment amounts:
- The investment for the facility is about €850 million. The company is targeting 120 GWh of aggregate battery production capacities in three gigafactories by 2030.

Project progress:
- The company already has an R&D center operational since 2020 in Bruges, near Bordeaux, and a state-of-the-art pilot plant in Nersac, in the New Aquitaine region. The other two gigafactories in Kaiserslautern, Germany, and Termoli, Italy, are expected to open up in 2025 and 2026 respectively.

Project type:
- The project is a new build gigafactory for manufacturing battery packs for electric vehicles.

Value chain stages:
- The facility covers the stages of cell fabrication and module assembly.

title: A PSA-Total battery factory for Hauts-de-France
notes:
Location:
- The project involves the construction of an automotive 'gigafactory' in Douvrin, Hauts-de-France, France, and in Kaiserslautern, Germany.

Capacity:
- The project aims to reach full power by 2030 with a cumulative capacity of 48GWh on both sites, equipping 1 million electric vehicles per year.

Investment amounts:
- The project represents an investment of more than €5 billion, including financial support of €1.3 billion from the French and German public authorities.

Project progress:
- The project has commenced with the R&D stage at the site in Bordeaux and the pilot site in Nersac. Mass production is scheduled to start in 2023.

Project type:
- The project involves a two-stage approach, with the first stage focusing on R&D and the second stage on mass production.

Value chain stages:
- The project covers the stages of cathode and anode manufacturing, cell fabrication, and module assembly.
